para.text: The original application shall be:
Signed or electronically signed by an individual having authority with respect to the application and having knowledge of the application; and
Verified under oath.
In its discretion, the Commission may prescribe the form of the application.
The applicant shall submit to the Commission:
One paper original of the application; and
One electronic copy of the application, including all attachments, in the format determined by the Commission.

In addition to filing the application with the Commission, the applicant shall simultaneously mail or provide an electronic copy of the application to the following persons (if by mail, number of copies):
The governing body and, if applicable, the executive of each county or municipal corporation in which any portion of the project will be located (one copy each);
The governing body and, if applicable, the executive of each county or municipal corporation within 1 mile of the proposed location of the project (one copy each);
Each member of the General Assembly representing any part of each county in which any portion of the project will be located (one copy each, if requested);
Each member of the General Assembly representing any part of each county within 1 mile of the proposed location of the project (one copy each, if requested);
The planning and zoning commission of each county and municipal corporation in which the project will be located (one copy);
Each owner of land, and each owner of adjacent land, on which proposed transmission lines will be located (notice only);
The Department of the Environment, as follows:
Director, Air and Radiation Administration (one copy); and
Director, Water and Science Administration (one copy);
The Department of Planning (one copy);
The Department of Natural Resources, as follows:
Department Secretary (one copy); and
Power Plant Research Program (one copy);
The Department of Agriculture, Soil Conservation Committee (one copy);
The Department of Commerce (one copy);
The Department of Transportation (one copy);
The Maryland Aviation Administration (one copy);
The State Highway Administration, as follows:
Administrator (one copy); and
Chief of Utilities Division, Office of Construction (one copy);
The U.S. Department of Interior (one copy);
The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (one copy);
The Federal Aviation Administration (one copy);
The Maryland Energy Administration (one copy);
The Maryland Department of Health (one copy);
The Maryland Historical Trust, Department of Planning (one copy);
The Office of People's Counsel (one copy);
The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (one copy);
Superintendent, Shenandoah National Park (one copy);
The local electric company or cooperative (one copy);
The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (one copy); and
The U.S. Department of Defense (one copy).
The applicant shall either mail a copy or provide an electronic copy of the application to any other State or local agency that may be affected.

For a proposed qualifying generating station, the applicant shall send by first-class mail a letter notice of the filing of the application to all residential and business addresses within a 1-mile radius of the proposed facility site for an urban area, and within a 3-mile radius of the proposed facility site for a rural area, and the letter notification shall include:
A fact sheet on the filed application, including the applicant’s name and website;
The type of project to be constructed and its nameplate capacity;
The project’s location;
The assigned case number;
The location at which the public may physically review the application;
The applicant’s designated community liaison officer;
Other relevant information;
The prehearing conference date;
The deadline for filing petitions to intervene;
A fact sheet concerning the Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity process; and
Information on how to access the applicant’s EJSCREEN Reports.

The applicant shall place a copy of the application as filed with the Commission at the public library branch closest to the proposed site of the facility, or other locations near the proposed site of the facility that permit public access and have adequate facilities for reviewing the application.

For fossil fuel generating stations subject to the requirements for a Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity under Public Utilities Article, §§7-207, 7-207.1, and 7-208, Annotated Code of Maryland, including those for which a waiver has been denied, the applicant shall:
Post, at minimum, one large sign at the site of the proposed facility that is visible from the streets, subject to applicable local restrictions and regulations;
File with the Commission, as an exhibit to its application, at least one picture of each posted sign; and

For a proposed qualifying generating station, file with the Commission a signed certification of the notification mailings in accordance with §D of this regulation, along with a complete list of mailing recipient names and addresses.

The Commission may hold hearings with any other state or local agency having jurisdiction to issue any permit, authority, or certificate that is required before construction or operation of a project can begin.
In order to ensure timely completion of the proceedings, the Commission may impose a schedule of procedural dates which is subject to change only for good cause shown.
Phased Proceeding Requests.
The applicant may request that the construction of a generating station be reviewed by the Commission in phases.
If a phased proceeding is requested and the request is granted by the Commission:
An applicant may file a partial application; and
The Commission may render separate findings of fact on any phase or issue within a phase.
Findings of fact rendered by the Commission under this section are not subject to further litigation unless warranted by new substantive issues or changed circumstances.
